docs.lead_paragraph: In New Jersey, rock music fans show up at concerts wearing T-shirts labeled "Captain Quaalude" and "Rorer."

headline.main: In 18 Months, Methaqualone Has Soared in Popularity Among the Young; Drunken Euphoria No Counterfeiting Withdrawal Symptoms Lack of Functioning No Figures on Deaths Changes Observed

docs.abstract: Article on increasing popularity and abuse of methaqualone among youthful drug users; drug, within span of 18 mos, has soared in popularity, and law enforcement officials in several communities rank it 3d as drug of choice among youths; researchers have warned that abuse of methaqualone has reached epidemic proportions; drug was 1st introduced in US in '65, and was initially heralded as a sleeping pill with fewer addictive characteristics than barbiturates; nationwide ints by NY Times finds that use of methaqualone is spreading among hs and college-age young people despite its decline in many college communities; effects of drug and efforts of law enforcement officials to combat its use discussed
docs.snippet: In New Jersey, rock music fans show up at concerts wearing T-shirts labeled "Captain Quaalude" and "Rorer."

docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON - There is no doubt that Barbara Cartland likes to talk: Words rush from her lips by the hundreds, usually at machine-gun speed. There is also no doubt that she likes to write: She is the author of about 150 romantic novels, several autobiographies, and, around the world, in hardcover and paperback, her books sell several million copies a year.

headline.main: At 71, Barbara Cartland Is Still a Crusader

docs.abstract: Article on accomplishments of B Cartland, Brit author of about 150 romantic novels and more recently promoter of health foods; int on work; illus

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: While medical services as a whole are not equipped to handle the human side of sickness, as opposed to the scientific side, some institutions here are making a serious attempt to change that.

headline.main: HOSPITALS WIDEN VIEW OF ILLNESS; Weekly Meetings Held Doctors Pretend' Hospitalization Cut Human Side Now Stressed Along With the Scientific

docs.abstract: Several NYC hosps are making serious attempt to handle the emotional problems attributed to human side of sickness, as opposed to the scientific side; programs involving patients and drs at St Luke's Hosp Center, Metropolitan Hosp and Montefiore Hosp and Med Center described
docs.snippet: While medical services as a whole are not equipped to handle the human side of sickness, as opposed to the scientific side, some institutions here are making a serious attempt to change that.
